instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , water damaged, wont start up, solved
threads.message:
thx for the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board view dukefawks!  
This is solved already but i will share the solution, very small amount of water damage, all the main voltages are fine, water was on y1905, i removed it see how corroded is that, and the tracks looked fine, but i measured anyway between y1905 and <CAPACITOR>C1905</CAPACITOR>, and it was broken, but even under the scope it did not look broken, install a small cable there to <RESISTOR>R1905</RESISTOR> and it works wit the original y1905, so the chip could not start the 25mhz crystal.
